titleStmt.title: A faithfull messenger sent after the Antinomians: to try their power in their last place of refuge, who are fled to Gods decrees for shelter, as Ioab did to the hornes of the altar, and say that they will dye there, I Kings 2. 29.30. Imprimatur Ja. Cranford.
titleStmt.author: Bakewell, Thomas, b. 1618 or 19.

titleStmt.title: A faithfull messenger sent after the Antinomians: to try their power in their last place of refuge, who are fled to Gods decrees for shelter, as Ioab did to the hornes of the altar, and say that they will dye there, I Kings 2. 29.30. Imprimatur Ja. Cranford.
titleStmt.author: Bakewell, Thomas, b. 1618 or 19.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by M. Okes for T. Bankes, and are to be sold in Black-fryers, on the top of Bridewel stairs,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A faithful messenger sent after the Antinomians, to their last refuge.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
